oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Decarbonylative Halogenation by a Vanadium Complex
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RANA, S
HAQUE, R
SANTOSH, G
MAITI, D
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ACTIVE DNA DEMETHYLATION
MECHANISTIC CONSIDERATIONS
DEPENDENT HALOPEROXIDASES
MEDIATED DEFORMYLATION
OXIDATIVE HALOGENATION
FUNCTIONAL MODELS
HYDROGEN-PEROXIDE
ACID
BIOSYNTHESIS
CHLORINATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Metal-catalyzed halogenation of the C-H bond and decarbonylation of aldehyde are conventionally done in nature. However, metal-mediated decarbonylative halogenation is unknown. We have developed the first metal-mediated decarbonylative halogenation reaction starting from the divanadium oxoperoxo complex K3V25+(O-2(2-))(4)(O2-)(2)(mu-OH) (1). A concerted decarbonylative halogenation reaction was proposed based on experimental observations.
